intro: Heliophila subeornuta, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth, glossy surface. Heliophila subeornuta is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in partial shade.
